comments.body: Seems like this is exported using `export default` here: https://github.com/yairEO/tagify/blob/master/src/tagify.js#L1534
Those interfaces need to be moved inside namespace Tagify

I changed it back to `export default` with interfaces inside namespace:
```typescript
declare namespace Tagify {
    interface TagfifySettings { }
    interface TagData { }
}
declare class Tagfify { }
export default Tagify;
```
But now, the "CI / test" is failing again with `NeedsExportEquals` and `NoDefaultExport`. And since I'm not allowed to touch the `tslint.json` as suggested in the error log below, I don't know how to fix this issue.

I don't know how the "CI / test" works. But it obviously checks against the original library. If it uses the npm package, it will only find an UMD js file, i.e. a transpiled version of the source file and as such without any `default` keyword.

Any advice will be appreciated! (Thanks for your time btw.)

```
ERROR: 1:1    npm-naming  The declaration doesn't match the JavaScript module 'yaireo__tagify'. Reason:
The declaration should use 'export =' syntax because the JavaScript source uses 'module.exports =' syntax and 'module.exports' can be called or constructed.

To learn more about 'export =' syntax, see https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/modules.html#export--and-import--require.
If you won't fix this error now or you think this error is wrong,
you can disable this check by adding the following options to your project's tslint.json file under "rules":

    "npm-naming": [true,{"mode":"code","errors":[["NeedsExportEquals",false]]}]
 See: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/npm-naming.md

ERROR: 475:1  npm-naming  The declaration doesn't match the JavaScript module 'yaireo__tagify'. Reason:
The declaration specifies 'export default' but the JavaScript source does not mention 'default' anywhere.

The most common way to resolve this error is to use 'export =' syntax instead of 'export default'.
To learn more about 'export =' syntax, see https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/modules.html#export--and-import--require.
If you won't fix this error now or you think this error is wrong,
you can disable this check by adding the following options to your project's tslint.json file under "rules":

    "npm-naming": [true,{"mode":"code","errors":[["NoDefaultExport",false]]}]
 See: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/npm-naming.md
```

Sorry i mispoke.. I didnt look at the unpkged file.. it does use `export=` https://unpkg.com/browse/@yaireo/tagify@3.22.1/dist/tagify.min.js 
So it does need to be `export=`. Sorry again for confusing.

Since these properties are internal, I would not even mention them in the docs (they might change anytime) and just mention `A list of tag data without internal properties (that usually start with two underscores)`
